item.title: Getting Started With NServiceBus in .NET
item.description: NServiceBus is a feature-rich messaging framework supporting many different message transports. It's developed and maintained by Particular Software. And it simplifies the process of building complex distributed systems across various cloud-based queueing technologies. The basic building blocks of NServiceBus are messages and endpoints. A message contains the required information to execute a business operation. Endpoints are logical entities that send and receive messages.
item.author: (Milan Jovanović)

item.title: Genetics firm 23andMe says user data stolen in credential stuffing attack
item.description: 23andMe has confirmed to BleepingComputer that it is aware of user data from its platform circulating on hacker forums and attributes the leak to a credential-stuffing attack.

item.title: Hidden information and solving Dominoes - Emir's blog
item.description: Some notes about the construction of a Block Dominoe playing algorithm for a hidden information variant of the game. I build a game simulator, learn from a heuristic algorithm and then develop some play-out based algorithms which seem fairly good. I conjecture the final algorithm approximates optimal play.

Last week, the topic of interest seemed to be YAML and how evil it is. I can't argue with that. Every time I've crossed paths with it, I've been irritated by both it and whoever decided to use it for their stuff.
